alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Frederick; Page; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:10PM EDT until June 22 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Clarke County in northwestern Virginia... South Central Frederick County in northwestern Virginia... Northern Page County in northwestern Virginia... Northeastern Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Warren County in northwestern Virginia... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Front Royal... Strasburg... Middletown... Chester Gap... Buckton... Riverside... Fort Valley... Riverton... Karo... Reliance... Cedarville... Glen Echo... Arco... Bentonville... Dilbeck... Nineveh... Browntown... Clary... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
